programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a psychic's claims to have received a sack of poison-pen letters, and concludes her apparent plight is all a cheap publicity stunt - until he uncovers a possible link between the hate mail and a local girl's death. Offbeat crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Selina Cadell

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A prostitute turns up at the station claiming to have been raped, and as Gently looks back at past cases, he is shocked to discover that very few have been successfully prosecuted - if they made it to court in the first place. Risking animosity from his colleagues, he becomes suspicious when he notices the same police inspector's name appearing repeatedly in the files. To complicate matters, the body of another rape victim is found, prompting a visit to the local brothel. Meanwhile, Bacchus has started an affair with Gemma, the wife of a fellow copper. Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and Lisa McGrillis star, with guest appearances from Denise Welch, Derek Riddell and Emily Woof

programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the drama. A couple wake up to find a strangled corpse on the hearthrug in their library - but help is at hand in the diminutive form of venerable amateur sleuth Miss Marple, who just happens to live next door. She agrees to investigate but, as her inquiries get under way, another body is discovered. Joan Hickson, Gwen Watford and Moray Watson star

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: Ken Stott stars as Ian Rankin's Edinburgh detective. Rebus tries to discover the significance of an intriguing clue left at the scene of an eminent doctor's murder - a small coffin containing an effigy of a baby. A subsequent killing suggests parallels with an unsolved case, and the investigation gradually focuses on one of the city's wealthiest families. Crime thriller, with Claire Price

Jack turns out to have a personal connection to the prime suspect in a teenage girl's murder, so he is taken off the case and replaced with another forensic scientist seconded to the Lyell Centre. But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters

Puzzled by the mystery, and with more suspects than he can shake a stick at, Inspector Craddock quickly enlists Miss Marple's help in solving the crime. Joan Hickson stars

programme.desc: Maddy's former colleague starts poking her nose into an unsolved murder at a spooky old house, so the investigative duo tag along. Thriller, with Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler and the team investigate another set of apparent copycat killings, with Buchan claiming the murders mirror those committed by notorious London gangsters Ronnie and Reggie Kray in the 1960s. programme.desc: The cop is on a knife-edge as he tries to cover up a death, appease the suspicious Baba and protect Jenny from any further harm. Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Photograph (2020)
programme.desc: Michael, a reporter, becomes fascinated by a picture of a woman, and wants to know her backstory. In the present day, following the death of her estranged mother, a devastated young woman finds a photo that will change her life forever. Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

Meanwhile, Jacob, Iain and Teddy are called out to help a telecoms engineer, who is hanging from a building by his safety lines, and Jan tries her best to change Gethin's mind

Drama based on the best-selling pair of memoirs by father and son David and Nic Sheff, starring Steve Carell and Timothée Chalamet

programme.desc: Ellie Heywood introduces a vibrant service of praise from Birmingham City Church, celebrating the festival of Pentecost. The service features a Pentecost message given by senior pastor Nick Whittome and includes live performances of popular worship songs, led by the singers and musicians from the church and directed by Kevin Levingston

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts checks out a plot of land in Newport, Jacqui Joseph visits a three-bed in Eastleigh, and Dion Dublin takes a look around a one-bed bungalow in Lichfield

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans makes an appeal on behalf of Melanoma Focus, a charity supporting patients and carers, as well as funding specialist skin cancer research across the UK

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass (2016)
programme.desc: Alice Kingsleigh has spent three years sailing the high seas. Upon her return to London from China, she returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save the Mad Hatter and her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp and Anne Hathaway

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the final day of the Premier League season

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie is furious when Terry stays out all night. To give him a taste of his own medicine, Annie leaves him home alone with the kids and bonds with Kate on a cross-country road trip. With their mother miles away, Peter and Pattie run wild. Starring Michelle Keegan and Warren Brown

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the concluding round of Premier League fixtures, as the final standings were confirmed. The matches taking place were Arsenal v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Emirates Stadium, Aston Villa v Brighton & Hove Albion at Villa Park, Brentford v Manchester City at Gtech Community Stadium, Chelsea v Newcastle United at Stamford Bridge, Crystal Palace v Nottingham Forest at Selhurst Park, Everton v Bournemouth at Goodison Park, Leeds United v Tottenham Hotspur at Elland Road, Leicester City v West Ham United at King Power Stadium, Manchester United v Fulham at Old Trafford and Southampton v Liverpool at St Mary's Stadium

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, searching for three items with the potential to be revived. She saves a pine chest of drawers for carpenter Martin Hough and a trio of utility chairs for upcycler Sarah Peterson. Sarah takes on a set of trestle table bases for her own project

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the Dry Garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol Klein reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. With a ban on peat in compost on the way, Arit Anderson investigates what that means for the industry and gardeners alike

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin visits Northern Ireland in the hope of gaining an understanding of the rich flavours of the beef from native cattle the Dexter. He also visits the east coast, where he discovers why local lobsters are so prized by chefs, and cooks up a Goan lobster curry, and a fillet of Dexter beef served with a garlic and parsley risotto with caramelised onions

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing seeks inspiration for his kitchen garden when he visits an expert herb grower in Bristol. Wildlife artist Robert Fuller reveals the species that thrive near his home in North Yorkshire during the summer months, and Nadiya Hussain learns how to smoke fish and shows how to make a delicious smoked haddock rarebit

programme.title: Big Cats About the House
programme.desc: Following the work of big cat expert Giles Clark, as he embarks on a mission to transform the Big Cat Sanctuary in Kent into a centre of global excellence for conservation. In the opening episode, Giles provides around the clock care to Maya, a five-day-old black jaguar cub neglected by her mother. Then, he travels to Cambodia to witness the dilemma clouded leopards are facing in the wild

programme.title: Ancient Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Michael Scott uses 3D scanning technology to reveal the historical secrets of ancient Athens and tell the story of how this remarkable city created the world's first democracy. He begins his journey on the Acropolis, where, in the late sixth century BC the people of Athens overthrew a tyrant and set up a democracy, and investigates a mysterious, asymmetrical temple called the Erechtheion that sits in the shadow of the world-famous Parthenon. To the south of the city, he clambers through a silver mine where an army of slaves once toiled inside the labyrinth of narrow tunnels

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the RAF Museum at Hendon in London, where items up for auction include a nautilus shell and some Superman film memorabilia. With antiques experts Michael Baggott and Mark Stacey

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the last leg of his railway journey around the north-west coast of England, visiting the childhood home of William Wordsworth in Cockermouth, Cumbria, and ending in Maryport, where the Solway Firth marks the border between England and Scotland

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Diana Yates demonstrate how to produce home-made fertiliser using comfrey, while George Anderson has an update from his own garden in Joppa and Beechgrove's head gardener Scott Smith reveals how to spot when seedlings are ready for potting on

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson discovers more about the quiet village of Ravenglass in the Lake District's National Park, which played a strategic role in the Roman empire. With the help of the Pennington family, whose ancestral home is Muncaster Castle, Ben is shown their latest Roman find, a unique stone slab with a Latin inscription that's been attributed to a Roman naval unit, Aelia Classica

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The BBC gardening team present the sights and sounds of the famous events, with highlights of the gardens and tips for amateur horticulturists

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The curators continue their restoration of Paul McCartney's childhood home in Liverpool, trying to track down a key section of wallpaper for the living room, and opening up a room the public has not yet seen - the bedroom where the former Beatle's parents slept. Across town, a project is under way to catalogue and clean a vast collection of photographs discovered in a four-storey Georgian house that was once the home and studio of Edward Chambré Hardman, one of Britain's most significant photographers

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy and Lance have one last day on the farm to pull out all the stops and find the gold. Plus, Terry's got a new gazebo, the perfect time for a rally

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Documentary about the wave of industrial action that engulfed the UK at the end of 2022, with access to union leaders including Mick Lynch of the RMT and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nursing. The opening edition charts the start of the strikes, with Lynch and the National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers at the forefront of the movement, with nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the Royal College of Nursing.union's 106-year history

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Lagerfeld
programme.desc: Award-winning director Michael Waldman goes in search of the real Karl Lagerfeld, who was one of the most flamboyant and recognisable figures in fashion, but also one of the most mysterious. Waldman tracks down those closest to the designer, including his friends, neighbour, lawyer, doctor, bodyguard and Chanel colleagues. He also meets the agent and nanny left in charge of Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, who he called the love of his life and who earned an estimated three million euros from modelling assignments

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The two finalists are challenged to make over two pubs in a busy tourist hotspot in Brighton. One designer will be transforming an award-winning gastro pub with a field to fork ethos, while the other competitor is tasked with turning a traditional pub into a fun day-to-night venue aimed at a younger clientele. Once the challenge is compete, the pair head back to the design studio where they are cross examined by Alan and the judges. Who will be crowned this year's winner?

programme.desc: The friends play spot the difference

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: A toy dinosaur rampages through the supermarket and scares the Grape Kids, but Carrot and Supertato work out it is remote-controlled and try to get it back in its box

programme.desc: Bitzer is in charge of making sure his master's rest is uninterrupted

programme.desc: Pieface falls under the influence of a fiery chilli

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the annual camping trip with Gramps, but Cheese wins an invitation to a big movie premiere and says she has to stay home for charity work

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Dolos might have a lead on finding Ant's grandparents

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The mobile unit must return a blob to London

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Eliza and Vanessa go head to head with Jaiden and Sukhbir as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate champions

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The brothers celebrate Mother's Day, while jaguar Kiera has a break from daughter Inka, and Tilly the red panda might be having a baby

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Mwaksy goes behind the scenes of CBBC drama Silverpoint, while Abby and Joel make a new bed out of upcycled clothes for Henry the dog

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall goes in search of wild and weird predators, finding out why tigers look green to their prey and why geckos have hairy toes

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Dog fanatic Sheridan Smith and her fluffy co-host Stanley are on a mission to find the nation's best professional dog groomer. Heat one sees the first four contestants working on a long-haired shih-tzu - one of the most popular breeds to grace British salons. After that they let their imaginations fly as they give four curly haired canines a teddy bear trim to parade on the dogwalk in front of their owners

programme.title: Animals Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Mongoose start wars to create a diversion for sneaky mating, while macaques kidnap babies to curry favour with their rivals. These behaviours prompt Liz Bonnin to investigate the animals who will stop at nothing to find a mate and raise a family. Liz reveals the fascinating science that lies behind some extraordinary tactics. In Tanzania, she finds out that sibling rivalry can actually benefit a whole hyena clan, and on the North American plains learns how promiscuity can be the key to having healthy prairie-dog pups. However, the presenter also discovers that such tactics are often the key to survival

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The play-offs sees the winning families from the heats compete for just two places in finals week. First, there's another unprepared challenge to test their creativity in the kitchen - a surprise pick 'n' mix of ingredients that they all have to cook with. They are then tasked to rustle up a family meal in a bid to impress judges Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks and secure a place in finals week. On the menu in this edition is duck, Jollof rice, churros and chocolate and orange tarts

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow chef Richard Corrigan for a discussion on the unsung and neglected produce in the British larder. The Irishman champions the cause of offal, but has his work cut out persuading Tom that kidneys are ever worth the effort, while the host tries to revive the profile of hake by cooking the fish in a button mushroom sauce. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack brings a German red wine to the table and Fast Show star Arabella Weir gets the inside track on why a good kitchen knife should last a lifetime

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look at the TV appearances made over the years by Swedish Academy Award-winning actress Ingrid Bergman, exploring the milestones of her life and career, including her appearances in Casablanca and Spellbound. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Casablanca (1942)
programme.desc: The American expat owner of a Moroccan nightclub is reunited with his old flame during the Second World War. Now married to a Czech freedom fighter, she needs his help to get them safely out of the country before they are captured by the Nazis - but the former lovers also have to wrestle the temptation to rekindle their simmering romance. Drama, with Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains and Paul Henreid

programme.title: Ancient Invisible Cities
programme.desc: In Turkey, Michael Scott uses 3D-scanning technology to examine the once enormous Hippodrome, which began as a stadium for chariot racing, though its foundations were later converted into a huge water cistern to supply the Emperor's Great Palace. Michael unearths a holy well, hidden 30 feet under a carpet shop and, conversely, walks high above the city on the most sophisticated and longest aqueduct of the Roman world, finding that part of the Great Palace of Constantine is now a burnt-out shell. Along the way Michael finds time for a shave in the Sultan's Grande Bazaar and uncovers the engineering innovations of the Suleymaniye Mosque

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find an intricately carved whale bone walking cane and an autograph book to sell at auction at the St Albans Cathedral and Abbey in Hertfordshire

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: TV journalists and former royal correspondents Jennie Bond and Simon McCoy rummage for hidden treasures around Devon, accompanied by experts Margie Cooper and Raj Bisram

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The curators continue their restoration of Paul McCartney's childhood home in Liverpool, trying to track down a key section of wallpaper for the living room, and opening up a room the public has not yet seen - the bedroom where the former Beatle's parents slept. Across town, a project is under way to catalogue and clean a vast collection of photographs discovered in a four-storey Georgian house that was once the home and studio of Edward Chambré Hardman, one of Britain's most significant photographers

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring and his platoon have their hands full with two German prisoners and the arrival of a suspicious Polish captain, while Walker sees a way to make easy money. Comedy first broadcast in 1968, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The BBC gardening team present the sights and sounds of the famous events, with highlights of the gardens and tips and tricks for amateur horticulturists

programme.title: Duran Duran at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of appearances by the band on the BBC, with performances on The Old Grey Whistle Test, Wogan and Top of the Pops. Featuring songs including Planet Earth, Girls on Film, Hungry Like the Wolf, Rio, Is There Something I Should Know?, A View to a Kill and Ordinary World

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Jessie Ware performs couple of numbers from her disco-infused fifth studio album That! Feels Good!, while Nottingham duo Sleaford Mods play a track from their latest LP UK Grim. Also appearing are Dave Okumu & the 7 Generations, Olivia Dean, and the Waeve, a collaboration between Blur's Graham Coxon and vocalist Rose Elinor Dougall. Jools chats to drummer Stewart Copeland, whose forthcoming new album Police Deranged for Orchestra sees him rework some of the biggest hits written and recorded by his band the Police

programme.title: Duran Duran: A Night In
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, Nick Rhodes, John Taylor and Roger Taylor sit back to watch and talk through personally-selected clips of archive television, music shows, movies, performances, adverts and children's shows that have inspired them across their career. The band discuss their influences from the worlds of film and art, referencing Blade Runner, Andy Warhol and Tomorrow's World, and ranging from Barbarella to Virginia Plain and Midnight Express

programme.title: Duran Duran: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: Highlights of the band's performance at the BBC Radio Theatre in December 2021, featuring classic hits Hungry Like the Wolf, Notorious, Ordinary World, Planet Earth and Save a Prayer as well as music from their most recent album Future Past

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ashley invites her party-loving friends to Echo Park to celebrate her birthday - testing her relationship with Gordon in the process. Comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Papadopoulos & Sons (2012)
programme.desc: A Greek millionaire loses everything he has in a financial crisis, leaving him with only one asset - his share in the fish and chip shop his father used to run. He is forced to return to his roots and work with his laidback brother to revive the family business. Comedy, starring Stephen Dillane, Georgia Groome and Georges Corraface

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letters X, Y and Z, concluding her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sammi Kinghorn presents the first of three visits to a hill farm in Cumbria, where 16-year-old shepherd Katie recruits her for springtime chores and assisting with a surprise birth. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, and Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales. Plus, a new regular strand following four young farmers from around the country

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Diana Yates demonstrate how to produce home-made fertiliser using comfrey, while George Anderson has an update from his own garden in Joppa and Beechgrove's head gardener Scott Smith reveals how to spot when seedlings are ready for potting on

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits Tweed Forest Park in the Borders, where he finds out how it is being future-proofed against climate change and extreme weather events. Arlene Stuart visits dairy cattle near Dumfries that are being studied to assess how 'happy' they are, while Cammy Wilson meets a couple who have developed their own environmentally friendly, organic chicken feed. Anne Lundon is on the banks of the River Tay working her way through the biggest reed beds in the country and hearing how they benefit both people and nature

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don journeys to the Mediterranean, the cradle of European civilisation, for the next stage in his horticultural tour. In Italy, he witnesses the elaborate stone and water gardens created during the high Renaissance. He also investigates the influence of Moorish culture on European gardens, visiting the Aguedal in Marrakesh, and Spain's magnificent Alhambra

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: New families the Bonehams, the Antonious, the Birds and the Fasayes are tasked with making comfort food for £10 and breakfast with a twist. Judges Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks will decide which three of them progress to the next round and which one is eliminated

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary tour of the country, laced with history, literature and stunning photography. Driving a clapped-out old VW camper van around the Galicia region on the Atlantic coast, Rick discovers places off the beaten track as he samples classic dishes of rural Spain, a country he believes has been underrated in cookery circles until quite recently

programme.title: Lover Come Back (1961)
programme.desc: Advertising executive Carol Templeton is determined to outdo her competitor Jerry Webster at every opportunity. When an important campaign comes up, she tries to beat him to it and clinch the deal, whatever the price. Unfortunately for her, she fails to realise the whole thing is a set-up devised by her hated rival. Romantic comedy, starring Doris Day, Rock Hudson, Tony Randall, Edie Adams and Jack Oakie

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the third and final stage of the women's race, featuring a 92km circuit that starts and finishes at The Mall in central London. Lorena Wiebes of the Netherlands dominated last year's race, winning every stage

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition from Bristol Cathedral. Natasha Raskin Sharp notices a painting of an apothecary on a piece of tin, and James Lewis looks at a valuable royal ring

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton follows the eastward course of the river South Esk from its source in the hills above Glen Clova to the Montrose Basin, and on to the sea. Along the way he searches for Scotland's rarest plant, goes electro-fishing to discover more about the ecology and general health of the whole river system, and rides a motorbike to the ancestral home of Harley-Davidson

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Stanley heads to Rome and meets up with old friend Claudia della Frattina, heading to a restaurant to order rigatoni all'amatriciana, one of the famous four Roman pastas. He also samples carbonara in the working-class neighbourhood of San Lorenzo and tries a selection of cheeses and sausages sourced from the sheep and pigs bred in the region.

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America
programme.desc: On the fourth leg of his journey through the continent, Simon travels through three of the world's most extreme environments as he takes in the salt flats of Bolivia, Brazil's Pantanal wetland region and Paraguay's Chaco Forest. In Bolivia, he meets a family making a living carving salt from the vast white expanse of the Uyuni flats, while in Brazil he has a close encounter with South America's apex predator, the jaguar. In Paraguay, Simon visits a Mennonites school, where traditionally clothed children are drilled in Bible texts and there are no smartphones to be seen

programme.title: Barry Humphries at the BBC
programme.desc: Alex Jones looks back at the highlights of the comedian and actor's career on a selection of BBC shows, sharing her own memories alongside some of Barry's funniest, rudest and most revealing moments from over the decades. It's a collection that demonstrates exactly why his alter egos of Dame Edna Everage and Sir Les Patterson were loved by comedy fans across the world, while also highlighting how it was Barry who was really one of a kind

programme.title: Rebels of Oz: Germaine, Clive, Barry and Bob
programme.desc: Howard Jacobson examines the impact of Australians Robert Hughes, Clive James, Barry Humphries and Germaine Greer on western culture. In the first of two parts, the author uncovers the backgrounds of the four, exploring the notion that their desire for knowledge was borne from living in a place they believed to be devoid of culture, and uncovering their time spent together as part of Sydney's 'Push' movement

programme.title: Rebels of Oz: Germaine, Clive, Barry and Bob
programme.desc: Part two of two. Howard Jacobson continues to chart the rise of Germaine Greer, Clive James, Barry Humphries and Robert Hughes, exploring how they became influential figures not just at home in Australia, but also around the world. He looks at their achievements as young adults, and how they found fame as a journalist, memoirist, comic performer and art critic respectively

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes: Almost Australian
programme.desc: On the final leg of her journey, the actress visits Gulf of Carpentaria to see where the wealth of the country comes from. At the McArthur River Mine, she is taken aback by the enormity and scale of this operation. Miriam arrives in suburban Brisbane where she meets one of the wealthiest couples in Australia and visits their wildlife research centre, where they are working to save the koala from extinction. After eight weeks and 10,000kms, Miriam's final stop is Burleigh Heads on the Gold Coast, where she accompanies a family taking part in 'Nippers', a surf education program for young Australians

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce is in Kent for the latest topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Gravesend to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Punt and Hugh Dennis present chart hits from October 6, 1994, in a selection of studio performances and videos from CJ Lewis, Cyndi Lauper, Madonna, Michelle Gayle, Bon Jovi, Elton John, Take That, Inxs and Whigfield. Plus, a vintage clip of the Stranglers

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel presents the edition from May 27, featuring music by Debbie Harry, Genesis, Japan, Soft Cell, Duran Duran and Madness

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jensen presents an edition from May 24, 1979, with performances by the Skids, Roxy Music, ELO, Tubeway Army, Liner, the Damned, Dollar, David Bowie, the Shadows, Blondie and Elvis Costello and the Attractions

programme.title: Cilla at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable TV appearances by Cilla Black from the BBC archives. The much-missed performer began her presenting career in 1968 on the BBC, having already become one of Britain's most popular singers. The programme features her appearances on Not Only, But Also, The Ken Dodd Show, Top of the Pops and The Royal Variety Performance as well as her self-titled series, plus her famous 1973 duet with Marc Bolan

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt

programme.title: Dusty
programme.desc: Entertainment showcase with host Dusty Springfield and her backing band of Madeline Bell, Lesley Duncan and Maggie Stredder. With special guest Mel Torme. First aired in August 1967

programme.title: Lulu's Back in Town
programme.desc: Archive performances by the Scottish singer of songs including Trolley Song, Suddenly You Love Me and Lulu's Back in Town, accompanied by backing group the Ladybirds. Featuring the Everly Brothers, who perform Bye Bye Love, and a comedy routine by Les Dawson

programme.title: Sir Cliff Richard at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back through the BBC archives at some of the singer's most memorable performances and biggest hits. Amongst the classic songs featured are Move It, The Young Ones, Living Doll, Bachelor Boy, the Eurovision Song Contest contenders Congratulations and Power to All Our Friends, Devil Woman, Miss You Nights, Wired for Sound and Cliff's much-praised 1980s duet with Van Morrison, Wherever God Shines His Light

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents music from October 13, 1994, by PJ & Duncan, Cappella, Gloria Estefan, Snap featuring Summer, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, Pato Banton, Two Thirds, Sting and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel presents the edition from May 27, featuring music by Debbie Harry, Genesis, Japan, Soft Cell, Duran Duran and Madness

programme.title: Cilla at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable TV appearances by Cilla Black from the BBC archives. The much-missed performer began her presenting career in 1968 on the BBC, having already become one of Britain's most popular singers. The programme features her appearances on Not Only, But Also, The Ken Dodd Show, Top of the Pops and The Royal Variety Performance as well as her self-titled series, plus her famous 1973 duet with Marc Bolan

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Michael's journey takes him to Bhutan, where he enjoys a last glimpse of the Himalaya before heading to Paro to enjoy a Buddhist festival. Here he witnesses archery contests and the unfolding of a giant scroll during the night of a full moon

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc: Python and broadcaster Michael Palin travels to north Wales to interview travel writer Jan Morris. Originally born as James, she shot to fame as part of the team that conquered Mount Everest in 1953. She spent the next two decades travelling the world, interviewing figures such as Che Guevara, producing reports for Panorama and writing books about other countries. Her 1972 gender reassignment was chronicled in her book Conundrum, and here she tells Michael the secret to her long and happy life

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Documentary charting the story of how film-makers used the Himalayan mountains for propaganda, as the world's great powers sent military-style expeditions to conquer the peaks between the 1920s and the 1960s. As a result, some of the range's most iconic mountaineering feats have been captured on film, including the preparations for Mallory and Irvine ill-fated ascent of Mount Everest in 1924, and the final conquest of the mountain by Hillary and Tenzing in 1953

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Arild secretly struggles, Jorund develops health anxiety and Finn decides the time has come to turn his life around. Ester learns what chemotherapy involves. In Norwegian

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Ester begins chemotherapy, as two of her closest friends tie the knot and her teenage son Lars falls in love. Jorund is still convinced there must be something wrong with him and orders a full medical examination. In Norwegian

programme.title: A Little Chaos (2014)
programme.desc: A female landscape designer in 17th-century France challenges boundaries of class and gender when she is chosen by King Louis XIV to create a new garden for the palace of Versailles. She becomes romantically involved with a fellow designer, whose creative philosophy is the opposite of hers. Period drama, starring Kate Winslet, Matthias Schoenaerts, Stanley Tucci and Alan Rickman, who also directed

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc: Python and broadcaster Michael Palin travels to north Wales to interview travel writer Jan Morris. Originally born as James, she shot to fame as part of the team that conquered Mount Everest in 1953. She spent the next two decades travelling the world, interviewing figures such as Che Guevara, producing reports for Panorama and writing books about other countries. Her 1972 gender reassignment was chronicled in her book Conundrum, and here she tells Michael the secret to her long and happy life

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Gilbert and Sullivan's Yeomen of the Guard
programme.desc: English National Opera's new production of the much-loved Gilbert & Sullivan classic, a fast-paced caper set in the Tower of London, with the action shifted to the 1950s, the time of the Queen's coronation. Colonel Fairfax is under sentence of death. Can his old friend, the Beefeater Sergeant Merryl, save him? And what of Merryl's daughter Phoebe, who has fallen hopelessly in love with the colonel? Anthony Gregory and Neal Davies lead the cast, with the Orchestra & Chorus of ENO conducted by Chris Hopkins

programme.title: Cilla in Scandinavia
programme.desc: Cilla Black hosts a 1971 show specially recorded in Stockholm on Midsummer's Day and on film locations in Norway, Sweden and Finland. Guests include Ringo Starr, Sven-Bertil Taube, Basil Brush, Hannu Mikkola and Marvin, Welch & Farrar

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Archive performances by Cilla Black, who sings Step Inside Love, For Once in My Life and Liverpool Lullaby. She also duets with Georrgie Fame and Dusty Springfield, and there's a comedy sketch from Graeme Garden, Tim Brooke-Taylor and Graham Chapman

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding

programme.title: Beautiful Boy (2018)
programme.desc: A New York Times writer worries when his son goes missing - but when he turns up two days later showing obvious signs of drug use, it proves to be just the first step on a journey through addiction, relapse and recovery that will last many years and impact all the family's lives. Drama based on the best-selling pair of memoirs by father and son David and Nic Sheff, starring Steve Carell and Timothée Chalamet

programme.desc: The latest political news and debate, and reports from around Wales

programme.title: 2023: A Celebration for Pentecost
programme.desc: Ellie Heywood introduces a vibrant service of praise from Birmingham City Church, celebrating the festival of Pentecost. The service features a Pentecost message given by senior pastor Nick Whittome and includes live performances of popular worship songs, led by the singers and musicians from the church and directed by Kevin Levingston

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts checks out a plot of land in Newport, Jacqui Joseph visits a three-bed in Eastleigh, and Dion Dublin takes a look around a one-bed bungalow in Lichfield

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross oversees oversees proceedings at the Royal Welsh Showground in Builth Wells as two teams scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell on for profit. Experts Philip Serrell and Thomas Plant attempt to guide the sides to success at auction in Cardiff

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans makes an appeal on behalf of Melanoma Focus, a charity supporting patients and carers, as well as funding specialist skin cancer research across the UK

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass (2016)
programme.desc: Alice Kingsleigh has spent three years sailing the high seas. Upon her return to London from China, she returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save the Mad Hatter and her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp and Anne Hathaway

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway, visits Usk for a stunning 10-mile circular walk which starts and ends at Usk Castle. Along the way, he sees the landscape from above as he hitches a ride in a glider, learns about an ancient orchard, visits some community allotments and helps local youngsters plant sunflowers. Archaeologist Dr Erin Lloyd Jones finds out what the Romans did for Wales and Matthew Bassett explores decorative Oriental-inspired tinware once made in the town

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Celebrated tenor and Radio Wales presenter Wynne Evans explores the BBC Wales archives of 1973. Highlights include Doctor Who at a local mine, the steam train up Yr Wyddfa and the opening of a new hotel for dogs. With music from Geraint Evans and comedy duo Ryan and Ronnie. Plus, Dave Edmonds demonstrates his recording techniques at Rockfield

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the final day of the Premier League season

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie is furious when Terry stays out all night. To give him a taste of his own medicine, Annie leaves him home alone with the kids and bonds with Kate on a cross-country road trip. With their mother miles away, Peter and Pattie run wild. Starring Michelle Keegan and Warren Brown

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the concluding round of Premier League fixtures, as the final standings were confirmed. The matches taking place were Arsenal v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Emirates Stadium, Aston Villa v Brighton & Hove Albion at Villa Park, Brentford v Manchester City at Gtech Community Stadium, Chelsea v Newcastle United at Stamford Bridge, Crystal Palace v Nottingham Forest at Selhurst Park, Everton v Bournemouth at Goodison Park, Leeds United v Tottenham Hotspur at Elland Road, Leicester City v West Ham United at King Power Stadium, Manchester United v Fulham at Old Trafford and Southampton v Liverpool at St Mary's Stadium

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Tina Daheley present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the food delivery giants making customers pay for items that were out of stock and never delivered. Plus, the issue of vouchers promised for holidays cancelled during the pandemic

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a pharmacy took a stand against shoplifters by creating a 'wall of shame' and the introduction of an innovative bodycam able to help shopkeepers identify prolific shoplifters and abusive customers. Plus, the work of a vehicle forensics expert following a ram raid on a jewellers in Leeds. Presented by Rav Wilding

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators confront firms bombarding elderly people with marketing phone calls and pressuring them into taking out insurance policies and setting up direct debits. They also confront a travel agent with a shop full of angry customers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts as two teams of antiques enthusiasts battle it out in Doune, Perthshire, under the guidance of experts Roo Irvine and Danny Sebastian. Natasha also meets leading tartan historian Peter MacDonald to learn about the origins of the iconic patterned cloth

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Callum has told Finn that Al is a corrupt cop. Al manages to convince Finn that Callum is mistaken, but things go from bad to worse when Jake McGrade assaults a security guard and steals a million pounds worth of whiskey from the Port Devine distillery. Siobhan is worried that Finn is moving too fast to prove that he's nothing like his father, but Concepta drops a massive bombshell to prove otherwise

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and designer Lucy Tiffney upcycle a pair of old lamps and a tired display cabinet at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: An Essex couple seekJonnie Irwin's help to find a home in North Yorkshire. Jonnie also visits the popular seaside resort of Whitby on a mission to work out why people love fish and chips so much and to discover who makes the best in town

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Morning Live presenter Gethin Jones shares his passion for gardening and Toby Buckland shares ideas on how to create a show-stopping moment in our gardens ahead of the start of summer. Presented by Angellica Bell and Nicki Chapman

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vanessa Simonite with what appears to be a piece of wood and a bag of bits, but which once was a beautiful mosaic table made by hand by her late husband. On hand to help repair this ultimate jigsaw puzzle is the barn's ceramic expert Kirsten Ramsay with help from woodwork whizz Will Kirk. A well-loved family recipe book and an art deco clock also receive much-needed restorations

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: On the eve of its final day, Sophie Raworth and Joe Swift reveal the winner of the BBC RHS People's Choice Award. Mary Berry asks the pavilion growers how best to create a stunning floral cutting garden, Adam Frost and Toby Buckland review the top planting trends that have emerged at this year's show, while Frances Tophill showcases the cocktails that can be made using botanicals and herbs grown at home

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits Tweed Forest Park in the Borders, where he finds out how it is being future-proofed against climate change and extreme weather events. Arlene Stuart visits dairy cattle near Dumfries that are being studied to assess how 'happy' they are, while Cammy Wilson meets a couple who have developed their own environmentally friendly, organic chicken feed. Anne Lundon is on the banks of the River Tay working her way through the biggest reed beds in the country and hearing how they benefit both people and nature

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Imaginations run wild in this semi-final as the contestants' latest brief is to cook a dish both 'theatrical and fantastical' in nature. The hopefuls need to create a dish that pushes boundaries, playing with both mind and senses. Later, judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace have to determine who warrants contesting Finals Week

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Steph McGovern hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with broadcaster Carol Vorderman and comedian Nabil Abdulrashid joining Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of the news

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Dom and Kay get in touch with a woman known as Thirsty Kirsty via a dating app on Clinton's phone, hoping she can help extract them from the mess they are in. They arrange to meet the mysterious contact they suspect is also operating undercover as they set about investigating the seemingly shady Superintendent Edwards by breaking into her office. Meanwhile, a revelation from PCSO Pricey causes Dom to believe that Clinton may not have been what he seemed. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker and Katherine Kelly

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by guests including multi-platinum singing legend and presenter Ronan Keating with his wife, producer-director, Storm. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Brentford defender Ethan Pinnock, Olympic hockey champion Hollie Pearne-Webb, world indoor 60m title-winner Richard Kilty and European gold medal-winning diver Tonia Couch join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Madison and Oly attend a protest rampage, dragging a nervous Michael along for the ride. Oly's hangover leads to a big parenting fail, while a confusing encounter between Jacinda and Santi's new girlfriend distracts her away from Reema's return from London. Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr

programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. Stephen and Felim's aversion to anything remotely healthy is called out by no-nonsense chef Brian McCann, who is convinced his seasonal platter will win them over. Stephen decides to share with Brian a grubby secret that demonstrates just how shameful his eating has become

In each episode, contestants are guided by a host of celebrity experts, with tonight's advice coming from Alison Hammond, James Martin, Dianne Buswell, Steve Redgrave, Rachel Parris, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Bash the Entertainer

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are David Haye, Esme Young, Sarah Hadland, Brian Conley, Alex Jones and Jordan North

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith's resolve is tested to breaking point when she finds herself in desperate need of painkillers after being bitten by a snake that is loose in the hospital. Meanwhile, Jacob, Iain and Teddy are called out to help a telecoms engineer, who is hanging from a building by his safety lines, and Jan tries her best to change Gethin's mind

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: When a body is found on a boat in the Clyde, the case takes the team to the Isle of Bute. Evidence points to a jilted lover, but a darker secret emerges as the team investigate. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker, Jamie Sives and Katie Leung

Drama based on the best-selling pair of memoirs by father and son David and Nic Sheff, starring Steve Carell and Timothée Chalamet

Upon her return to London from China, she returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save the Mad Hatter and her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp and Anne Hathaway

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes

programme.title: Final Score

programme.title: Weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie is furious when Terry stays out all night. To give him a taste of his own medicine, Annie leaves him home alone with the kids and bonds with Kate on a cross-country road trip. With their mother miles away, Peter and Pattie run wild. Starring Michelle Keegan and Warren Brown

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the concluding round of Premier League fixtures, as the final standings were confirmed. programme.title: Fast & Furious 7 (2015)
programme.desc: After defeating Owen Shaw and his crew and securing amnesty for their past crimes, Dom, Brian and the rest of the team return home to live normal lives again. However Shaw's older brother Deckard - a rogue special forces assassin vows revenge on Dom, who he holds responsible for leaving Owen in a coma. Action thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Jason Statham and Paul Walker in his last film role

programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: Million Pound Pawn
programme.desc: Return of the documentary about pawnbrokers and their customers, this time lifting the lid on the fast-moving and fascinating world of luxury pawnbroking on the Costa Del Sol. Sheffield-based pawnbroker Dan arrives in Spain with big plans to expand his business, and that means tapping into his local contacts to secure the very best clients. First up he meets Aiden, a classic car restorer who is looking to sell his 1960s Rolls-Royce for more than £300,000

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Dominica, taking a trip into the wild rainforests to the island's most famous waterfall. He prepares twice-fried plantains on the black sands of Picard Beach, discovers a local recipe using tiny fish that gather in Dominica's rivers, and acquires some cassava bread from the Kalinago community, to serve with his Calypso chicken

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny needs all his strength as he faces a 14-metre rock climb, but will he reach the Dare Master flag at the top?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Keen to prove that he is hard-working to Queen Libby and his parents, Lloyd volunteers to work in the ant colony for a day, swapping with ant Annie 209 to replace him at home. However, things don't go to plan, and Lloyd creates chaos in the colony...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to educate PB about the danger of spiders by luring one out with a decoy fly - his clumsy attempts attract a curious spider called Julie, who PB immediately wants to befriend. Can Lloyd accept that some spiders may not be all that bad?

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Part two of two. International Rescue launches a full-scale operation to recover a stolen prototype from The Mechanic

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Now holding all three rings, the heroes ask the Monkey King what is next - before he can answer, though, Ne Zha arrives. While the Monkey King holds Ne Zha off, Monkie Kid and the heroes must get the rings to a mystic mountain where they can rekindle its fire - However, when the Macaque arrives supercharged with Bone Demon power, things go from bad to worse...

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Now the ritual has been started, it can't be stopped - and worse still, something is happening to Mei. Ancient secrets are revealed as the Monkey King finally tells the heroes that there is a fourth ring - all of the Samadhi Fire is absorbed into Mei, and there are now two unstoppable forces for the heroes to contend with. The Monkie Kid team is pushed to breaking point, and nothing will be the same again!

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows 10-year-old Craig Williams and his two friends, Kelsey and John Paul, as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek which acts as a utopia where children reign

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows 10-year-old Craig Williams and his two friends, Kelsey and John Paul, as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek which acts as a utopia where children reign

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by Simply Red's Mick Hucknall, who tucks into dishes of brill and lamb, and there are delicious recipes from chefs Wolfgang Puck and Francesco Mazzei, while Alysia Vasey drops by with advice on seaside foraging

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner demonstrate home-cooked takes on takeaway favourites, including a Korean-style fried chicken dish with a spicy, sticky and sweet sauce, and spicy bean burgers loaded with flavour and packed with nutrients. Last up is John's tandoor-style lamb with Lisa's peas and paneer

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to New Orleans and after delving into a roadside seafood market, he cooks in Louis Armstrong Park and meets singer Robin Barnes. Lunch is courtesy of local favourite the Palace Café, where redfish is on the menu, and James finishes his stay by cooking on a balcony in the centre of the French Quarter and sipping of one of the local cocktails

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Live Gallagher Premiership Rugby Union
programme.desc: Saracens v Sale Sharks (Kick-off 3.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents coverage of the final, which comes from Twickenham. These two teams finished as the top two during the regular season and the semi-finals went to form, with Saracens prevailing 38-15 against Northampton Saints and the Sharks overcoming Leicester Tigers 21-13. Both meetings between the teams this term have been won by the home team, with Sarries winning 33-22 in October and Sale getting a measure of revenge with a 35-24 win two months ago. With analysis from Topsy Ojo, Maggie Alphonsi and Danny Care, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and David Flatman

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps, cute kids and practical jokes, including a car bonnet flying open on a motorway, a teenager terrified by a seagull and a toddler catching out her family with a classic gag - fake poo

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase

programme.title: In for a Penny

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hellboy (2004)
programme.desc: A thwarted Nazi experiment lands the Allies with an unexpected visitor from another dimension in the form of a bright-red demon. A secretive US government agency fosters the little devil and he grows up to be its crucial weapon against the forces of darkness - but the re-emergence of the sinister wizard Rasputin proves a challenge even for him. Action fantasy based on the comic-book series, with Ron Perlman, John Hurt, Selma Blair and Karel Roden

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny experiences the thrill of a flying trapeze, but can he catch the bar and secure a win as the Dare Master?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd hears that Berry is moving into his own place, and to avoid looking immature by comparison, Lloyd finds himself caught up in a spiralling series of lies as he tries to convince everyone that he's moving into a luxurious giant mango in the big bin.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd wants to show everyone that he can manage without Abacus, but he soon gets into a series of disasters on his own. He ends up lost in a rug, covered in sticky orange juice, and being chased by hungry carpet beetles that may or may not to want to eat him...

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Gordon, Lady Penelope, Brains and Parker help an explorer with his expedition to find the lost city of Atlantis. With the voice of Jack Whitehall

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls
programme.desc: The Super Hero Girls decide to go in together to buy their first car, but quickly learn that splitting an automobile six ways may prove to be their deadliest foe yet! / Diana is asked to sing in a talent show, but when she uses a magical artifact to hide how bad she is at singing, she unleashes mayhem onto Metropolis.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. In order to avoid ruining his super cool, geeky greasy hairdo, Mo wants to avoid taking the shower Selina is imposing on him before he can go to the arcade for a livestream with the city's best gamers. He asks the Scepter for the ability to smell good without washing. He's now giving off this delicious magnolia scent, but he's also starting to sweat shower gel profusely! Mo has to think fast and fix his problem before Maya sees what he's doing!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo and Lenny are finally going to watch the movie they've been waiting for. But as they arrive at the cashier to buy their tickets, they are turned away because they are too young and can only come in with an adult. Impatient and outraged, Mo decides to ask for the power to age so he can accompany Lenny to see the movie. But with half-power, neither Mo, nor Sam age: everyone around them gets younger- mentally! They act like immature kids that are impossible to handle.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Enfield, north London, Alan Titchmarsh and his team transform a garden for Yvonne, a woman who has devoted her life to combatting knife crime after the death of her son who was tragically murdered when he was just 17-years-old. Alan's design is all about the garden becoming a healing space, where Yvonne can remember her son, and where the family can come together again. Elsewhere, Katie Rushworth learns just how healing nature can be at the Cascades Gardens in Derbyshire.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: A special countdown of the greatest performances in the show's history, featuring behind-the-scenes footage of the unmasked singers from season six

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice (1967)
programme.desc: James Bond is sent on a mission to uncover the truth behind the disappearances of Soviet and American space capsules before the mutually suspicious superpowers go to war. The trail leads to Japan, where Bond finally comes face to face with his arch-enemy Blofeld. Spy thriller, starring Sean Connery, Donald Pleasence, Akiko Wakabayashi and Bernard Lee

programme.desc: Gary Lineker returns with the game show as Jacqui, Garren, Anika, Susanne, Rob and Julian answer questions to remain in with a chance of taking away up to £100,000. Players position themselves in a row of seats one behind another, with one wrong answer seeing them relegated to the back of the line and in real danger of leaving with nothing

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The members of amateur operatic society the Midsomer Mummers are busy rehearsing for their charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in their theatre. Barnaby and Winter's investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to be centre stage. Crime drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Nick Hendrix, with Kevin Whately, Samantha Spiro and Shobna Gulati

programme.title: Safe House (2012)
programme.desc: A CIA agent stationed in South Africa is sent to question a rogue operative, who has been arrested years after betraying the agency, only to be attacked by mercenaries hired to capture the fugitive. As they flee for their lives, the interrogator has to contend with not only the enemies hunting them, but also the mind games of his prisoner. Thriller, with Denzel Washington and Ryan Reynolds

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: In Nottingham's Albert Hall, David Dickinson and his dealers set up stall. Henry Nicholls flexes his spending muscles on a collection of hero comics and Tim Hogarth struggles to seal a deal on a 'blingy' signet ring. Plus, Stewart offers a princely sum for a silver box with royal connections

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends join forces to take on the Tenable tower, answering questions about top 10 lists, then trying to score a perfect 10 in the final round. Sally Lindsay hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Lisa, Anil, Eva and Brian pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charles's mother Claudette takes every opportunity to hurt Manpreet's feelings off the back of yesterday's complaints. Ryan and Gail are embarrassed when Charity catches them after they've spent the night together. Tom tries to make amends with Belle

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An anxious Paul delays his appearance in court, while Billy confides in Dee-Dee how worried he is about his partner. Roy is brought up short with chest pains during a dog walk, prompting Evelyn to call an ambulance. Sally suggests Craig and Tim should find a common hobby and Isabella gets bad news about her home back in Italy

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Omid Djalili, Richard Whitehead, Jenny Eclair and Clive Mantle take on quiz experts Mark Labbett, Anne Hegerty, Shaun Wallace, Paul Sinha, Jenny Ryan and Darragh Ennis, hoping to win big money for their chosen charities

programme.desc: Greengrass befriends a travelling musician (guest star Gary Barlow) who spreads a little disharmony in Aidensfield, while Jackie's parents drop in unexpectedly, casting a shadow over her relationship with Mike - and all at once domestic bliss becomes a thing of the past in the Bradley household. With Bill Maynard, Jason Durr and Fiona Dolman

programme.title: Heartbeat
